responses.description: The property key is the metric name

parameters.name: duration
parameters.description:
For historical stats and/or logs where time range is needed, you can specify the time range in a few different ways:
  * ?start=1430000000&end=1430864000	specify the start / end
  * ?end=1430864000&duration=1d	specify end time and duration
  * ?duration=1d	specify duration, end will be now() in seconds

parameters.name: interval
parameters.description: Aggregation works by giving a time range plus interval (e.g. 1d, 1h, 10m) where aggregation function would be applied to.

responses.description: An organization usualy represents a customer - which has inventories, licenses. An Organization can contain multiple sites. A site usually represents a deployment at the same location (a campus, an office).

parameters.description: if this org is under trial period

parameters.name: usage_types

responses.description: Security Policy is designed to audit / catch discripancies between whats intended to be running versus whats actually running in a network. Many big organizations have separated Security and IT team (for good reasons). Each site can be assigned a security policy. Whenever an AP is provisioned, the configuration will be checked against the security policy. Any violations will be flagged in Device Config History where you can search for the when and where the violation occurs.

responses.description:
WLAN

**Note**: portal_template will be forked out of wlan objects soon. To fetch portal_template, please query portal_template_url. To update portal_template, use Wlan Portal Template.

WLAN

**Note**: portal_template will be forked out of wlan objects soon. To fetch portal_template, please query portal_template_url. To update portal_template, use Wlan Portal Template.

WLAN

**Note**: portal_template will be forked out of wlan objects soon. To fetch portal_template, please query portal_template_url. To update portal_template, use Wlan Portal Template.

WxLAN Tag
* type:
** client: created manually (e.g. on wireless client table, when they spot a device of interest, they can create an wxlan tag for it
** resource: created automatically when we discover a network resource
** subnet: create automatically when a subnet is discovered

* match:
** wlan_id, ap_id: values are a list of Wlan / Device ids
** client_mac: values are a list of MAC addresses

* radius_group: this is a smart tag that matches RADIUS-Filter-ID, Airespace-ACL-Name (VendorID=14179, VendorType=6) / Aruba-User-Role (VendorID=14823, VendorType=1)
* radius_username: this matches the ATTR-User-Name(1)
* radius_class: thie matches the ATTR-Class(25)
* radius_attr: the values are [ 6=1, 26=10.2.3.4 ], this support other RADIUS attributes where we know the type
* radius_vendor: the values are [ 14179.10=1, 14178.16=1.2.3.4 ], this matches vendor attributes and will be dynamically evaluated

WxLAN Tag
* type:
** client: created manually (e.g. on wireless client table, when they spot a device of interest, they can create an wxlan tag for it
** resource: created automatically when we discover a network resource
** subnet: create automatically when a subnet is discovered

* match:
** wlan_id, ap_id: values are a list of Wlan / Device ids
** client_mac: values are a list of MAC addresses

* radius_group: this is a smart tag that matches RADIUS-Filter-ID, Airespace-ACL-Name (VendorID=14179, VendorType=6) / Aruba-User-Role (VendorID=14823, VendorType=1)
* radius_username: this matches the ATTR-User-Name(1)
* radius_class: thie matches the ATTR-Class(25)
* radius_attr: the values are [ 6=1, 26=10.2.3.4 ], this support other RADIUS attributes where we know the type
* radius_vendor: the values are [ 14179.10=1, 14178.16=1.2.3.4 ], this matches vendor attributes and will be dynamically evaluated

WxLAN Tag
* type:
** client: created manually (e.g. on wireless client table, when they spot a device of interest, they can create an wxlan tag for it
** resource: created automatically when we discover a network resource
** subnet: create automatically when a subnet is discovered

* match:
** wlan_id, ap_id: values are a list of Wlan / Device ids
** client_mac: values are a list of MAC addresses

* radius_group: this is a smart tag that matches RADIUS-Filter-ID, Airespace-ACL-Name (VendorID=14179, VendorType=6) / Aruba-User-Role (VendorID=14823, VendorType=1)
* radius_username: this matches the ATTR-User-Name(1)
* radius_class: thie matches the ATTR-Class(25)
* radius_attr: the values are [ 6=1, 26=10.2.3.4 ], this support other RADIUS attributes where we know the type
* radius_vendor: the values are [ 14179.10=1, 14178.16=1.2.3.4 ], this matches vendor attributes and will be dynamically evaluated

parameters.description: Amount of power being used by the interface at the time the command is executed. Unit in watts.

parameters.name: duration
parameters.description:
For historical stats and/or logs where time range is needed, you can specify the time range in a few different ways:
  * ?start=1430000000&end=1430864000	specify the start / end
  * ?end=1430864000&duration=1d	specify end time and duration
  * ?duration=1d	specify duration, end will be now() in seconds

  * ?duration=1d	specify duration, end will be now() in seconds

responses.description:
WLAN

**Note**: portal_template will be forked out of wlan objects soon. To fetch portal_template, please query portal_template_url. To update portal_template, use Wlan Portal Template.

WLAN

**Note**: portal_template will be forked out of wlan objects soon. To fetch portal_template, please query portal_template_url. To update portal_template, use Wlan Portal Template.

WLAN

**Note**: portal_template will be forked out of wlan objects soon. To fetch portal_template, please query portal_template_url. To update portal_template, use Wlan Portal Template.

WxLAN Tag
* type:
** client: created manually (e.g. on wireless client table, when they spot a device of interest, they can create an wxlan tag for it
** resource: created automatically when we discover a network resource
** subnet: create automatically when a subnet is discovered

* match:
** wlan_id, ap_id: values are a list of Wlan / Device ids
** client_mac: values are a list of MAC addresses

* radius_group: this is a smart tag that matches RADIUS-Filter-ID, Airespace-ACL-Name (VendorID=14179, VendorType=6) / Aruba-User-Role (VendorID=14823, VendorType=1)
* radius_username: this matches the ATTR-User-Name(1)
* radius_class: thie matches the ATTR-Class(25)
* radius_attr: the values are [ 6=1, 26=10.2.3.4 ], this support other RADIUS attributes where we know the type
* radius_vendor: the values are [ 14179.10=1, 14178.16=1.2.3.4 ], this matches vendor attributes and will be dynamically evaluated

WxLAN Tag
* type:
** client: created manually (e.g. on wireless client table, when they spot a device of interest, they can create an wxlan tag for it
** resource: created automatically when we discover a network resource
** subnet: create automatically when a subnet is discovered

* match:
** wlan_id, ap_id: values are a list of Wlan / Device ids
** client_mac: values are a list of MAC addresses

* radius_group: this is a smart tag that matches RADIUS-Filter-ID, Airespace-ACL-Name (VendorID=14179, VendorType=6) / Aruba-User-Role (VendorID=14823, VendorType=1)
* radius_username: this matches the ATTR-User-Name(1)
* radius_class: thie matches the ATTR-Class(25)
* radius_attr: the values are [ 6=1, 26=10.2.3.4 ], this support other RADIUS attributes where we know the type
* radius_vendor: the values are [ 14179.10=1, 14178.16=1.2.3.4 ], this matches vendor attributes and will be dynamically evaluated

** subnet: create automatically when a subnet is discovered

* match:
** wlan_id, ap_id: values are a list of Wlan / Device ids
** client_mac: values are a list of MAC addresses

* radius_group: this is a smart tag that matches RADIUS-Filter-ID, Airespace-ACL-Name (VendorID=14179, VendorType=6) / Aruba-User-Role (VendorID=14823, VendorType=1)
* radius_username: this matches the ATTR-User-Name(1)
* radius_class: thie matches the ATTR-Class(25)
* radius_attr: the values are [ 6=1, 26=10.2.3.4 ], this support other RADIUS attributes where we know the type
* radius_vendor: the values are [ 14179.10=1, 14178.16=1.2.3.4 ], this matches vendor attributes and will be dynamically evaluated
